container-title: Cf. George Terborgh, The Bogey of Economic Maturity
title: 20 percent would represent approximately the gross amount of the gross national product devoted each year to capital formation (excluding consumers’ equipment). When allowance is made for capital consumption, however, net annual savings have been closer to 12 percent
For a statistical refutation of this fallacy consult George Terborgh, The Bogey of Economic Maturity
Index American AAA plan, 79 capital absorption
